   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between six Diameter nodes connected as follows.
   23: %%
   24: %%                  ---- SERVER.REALM1  (TLS after capabilities exchange)
   25: %%                /
   26: %%               /  ---- SERVER.REALM2  (ditto)
   27: %%              | /
   28: %%   CLIENT.REALM0 ----- SERVER.REALM3  (no security)
   29: %%              | \
   30: %%               \  ---- SERVER.REALM4  (TLS at connection establishment)
   31: %%                \
   32: %%                  ---- SERVER.REALM5  (ditto)
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: -module(diameter_tls_SUITE).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   38: -export([run/0]).
   39: 
   40: %% common_test wrapping
   41: -export([
   42:          %% Framework functions
   43:          suite/0,
   44:          all/0,
   45:          init_per_suite/1,
   46:          end_per_suite/1,
   47:          init_per_testcase/2,
   48:          end_per_testcase/2,
   49:         
   50:          %% The test cases
   51:          parallel/1
   52:         ]).
   53: 
   54: %% diameter callbacks
   55: -export([prepare_request/3,
   56:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   57:          handle_answer/4,
   58:          handle_request/3]).
   59: 
   60: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   61: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
   62: 
   63: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   64: 
   65: 
   66: %% ===========================================================================
   67: 
   68: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   69: 
   70: -define(CLIENT,  "CLIENT.REALM0").
   71: -define(SERVER1, "SERVER.REALM1").
   72: -define(SERVER2, "SERVER.REALM2").
   73: -define(SERVER3, "SERVER.REALM3").
   74: -define(SERVER4, "SERVER.REALM4").
   75: -define(SERVER5, "SERVER.REALM5").
   76: 
   77: -define(SERVERS, [?SERVER1, ?SERVER2, ?SERVER3, ?SERVER4, ?SERVER5]).
   78: 
   79: -define(DICT_COMMON,  ?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON).
   80: 
   81: -define(APP_ALIAS, the_app).
   82: -define(APP_ID, ?DICT_COMMON:id()).
   83: 
   84: -define(NO_INBAND_SECURITY, 0).
   85: -define(TLS, 1).
   86: 
   87: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   88: -define(SERVICE(Host, Dict),
   89:         [{'Origin-Host', Host},
   90:          {'Origin-Realm', realm(Host)},
   91:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   92:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   93:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   94:          {'Inband-Security-Id', [?NO_INBAND_SECURITY]},
   95:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [Dict:id()]},
   96:          {application, [{alias, ?APP_ALIAS},
   97:                         {dictionary, Dict},
   98:                         {module, #diameter_callback{peer_up = false,
   99:                                                     peer_down = false,
  100:                                                     pick_peer = false,
  101:                                                     handle_error = false,
  102:                                                     default = ?MODULE}},
  103:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
  104: 
  105: %% Config for diameter:add_transport/2. In the listening case, listen
  106: %% on a free port that we then lookup using the implementation detail
  107: %% that diameter_tcp registers the port with diameter_reg.
  108: -define(TCONNECT(PortNr, Caps, Opts),
  109:         {connect, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  110:                    {transport_config, [{raddr, ?ADDR},
  111:                                        {rport, PortNr},
  112:                                        {ip, ?ADDR},
  113:                                        {port, 0}
  114:                                        | Opts]},
  115:                    {capabilities, Caps}]}).
  116: -define(TLISTEN(Caps, Opts),
  117:         {listen, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  118:                   {transport_config, [{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | Opts]},
  119:                   {capabilities, Caps}]}).
  120: 
  121: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
  122: -define(LOGOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  123: 
  124: -define(TL(F),    ?TL(F, [])).
  125: -define(TL(F, A), ?LOG("DTLSS", F, A)).
  126: 
  127: 
  128: %% ===========================================================================
  129: %% common_test wrapping
  130: 
  131: suite() ->
  132:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  133: 
  134: all() ->
  135:     [parallel].
  136: 
  137: %% Shouldn't really have to know about crypto here but 'ok' from
  138: %% ssl:start() isn't enough to guarantee that TLS is available.
  139: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  140:     ?TL("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  141:         "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  142:     Config2 = ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config),
  143:     try
  144:         [] == (catch make_certs(dir(Config2)))
  145:             orelse throw({?MODULE, no_certs}),
  146:         ok == crypto:start() orelse throw({?MODULE, no_crypto}),
  147:         ok == ssl:start() orelse throw({?MODULE, no_ssl}),
  148:         Config2
  149:     catch
  150:         {?MODULE, E} ->
  151:             {skip, E}
  152:     end.
  153: 
  154: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  155:     ?TL("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  156:         "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  157:     ssl:stop(),
  158:     crypto:stop(),
  159:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  160: 
  161: %% This test case can take a *long* time, so if the machine is too slow, skip
  162: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  163:     ?TL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  164:         "~n   Config: ~p"
  165:         "~n   => check factor", [Case, Config]),
  166:     Key = dia_factor,
  167:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
  168:         {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 10) ->
  169:             ?TL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> Too slow (~w) => SKIP",
  170:                 [Case, Factor]),
  171:             {skip, {machine_too_slow, Factor}};
  172:         _ ->
  173:             ?TL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> run test", [Case]),
  174:             Config
  175:     end;
  176: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  177:     ?TL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  178:     Config.
  179: 
  180: 
  181: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  182:     ?TL("end_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  183:     Config.
  184: 
  185: 
  186: %% ===========================================================================
  187: 
  188: parallel(Config) ->
  189:     ?TL("parallel -> entry"),
  190:     Res = run(dir(Config), false),
  191:     ?TL("parallel -> done when"
  192:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  193:     Res.
  194: 
  195: dir(Config) ->
  196:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
  197: 
  198: 
  199: %% ===========================================================================
  200: 
  201: run() ->
  202:     Tmp = ?MKTEMP("diameter_tls"),
  203:     try
  204:         run(Tmp, true)
  205:     after
  206:         file:del_dir_r(Tmp)
  207:     end.
  208: 
  209: run(Dir, B) ->
  210:     ?TL("run -> start crypto"),
  211:     crypto:start(),
  212:     ?TL("run -> start ssl"),
  213:     ssl:start(),
  214:     try
  215:         ?TL("run -> try run traffic"),
  216:         ?RUN([{[fun traffic/2, Dir, B], 60000}])
  217:     after
  218:         ?TL("run(after) -> stop diameter"),
  219:         diameter:stop(),
  220:         ?TL("run(after) -> stop ssl"),
  221:         ssl:stop(),
  222:         ?TL("run(after) -> stop crypto"),
  223:         crypto:stop(),
  224:         ?TL("run(after) -> done"),
  225:         ok
  226:     end.
  227: 
  228: traffic(Dir, true) ->
  229:     ?TL("traffic(true) -> make certs"),
  230:     [] = make_certs(Dir),
  231:     traffic(Dir, false);
  232: 
  233: traffic(Dir, false) ->
  234:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> start diameter"),
  235:     ok = diameter:start(),
  236:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> start (diameter) services"),
  237:     Servers = start_services(Dir),
  238:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> add transports"),
  239:     Connections = add_transports(Dir, Servers),
  240:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> calls"),
  241:     [] = ?RUN([[fun call/1, S] || S <- ?SCRAMBLE(?SERVERS)]),
  242:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> remove transports"),
  243:     [] = remove_transports(Connections),
  244:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> stop (diameter) services"),
  245:     [] = stop_services(),
  246:     ?TL("traffic(false) -> done"),
  247:     ok.
  248: 
  249: make_certs(Dir) ->
  250:     ?RUN([[fun make_cert/2, Dir, B] || B <- ["server1",
  251:                                              "server2",
  252:                                              "server4",
  253:                                              "server5",
  254:                                              "client"]]).
  255: 
  256: start_services(Dir) ->
  257:     Servers = [{S, {_,_} = server(S, sopts(S, Dir))} || S <- ?SERVERS],
  258:     ok = diameter:start_service(?CLIENT, ?SERVICE(?CLIENT, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  259:     Servers.
  260: 
  261: add_transports(Dir, Servers) ->
  262:     true = diameter:subscribe(?CLIENT),
  263:     Opts = ssl_options(Dir, "client"),
  264:     [{N, S, connect(?CLIENT, S, copts(N, Opts))} || {N,S} <- Servers].
  265: 
  266: %% Remove the client transports and expect the corresponding server
  267: %% transport to go down.
  268: remove_transports(Connections) ->
  269:     [] = [T || S <- ?SERVERS, T <- [diameter:subscribe(S)], T /= true],
  270:     [] = ?RUN([[fun disconnect/1, T] || T <- Connections]),
  271:     [S || S <- ?SERVERS,
  272:           I <- [receive #diameter_event{service = S, info = I} -> I end],
  273:           down /= catch element(1, I)].
  274: 
  275: disconnect({_, {_LRef, _PortNr}, CRef}) ->
  276:     ok = diameter:remove_transport(?CLIENT, CRef).
  277: 
  278: stop_services() ->
  279:     [{H,T} || H <- [?CLIENT | ?SERVERS],
  280:               T <- [diameter:stop_service(H)],
  281:               T /= ok].
  282: 
  283: %% ===========================================================================
  284: %% diameter callbacks
  285: 
  286: %% prepare_request/3
  287: 
  288: prepare_request(#diameter_packet{msg = Req},
  289:                 ?CLIENT,
  290:                 {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  291:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  292:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  293:         = Caps,
  294: 
  295:     {send, set(Req, [{'Session-Id', diameter:session_id(OH)},
  296:                      {'Origin-Host',  OH},
  297:                      {'Origin-Realm', OR}])}.
  298: 
  299: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  300: 
  301: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer) ->
  302:     discard.
  303: 
  304: %% handle_answer/4
  305: 
  306: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  307:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  308:     Rec.
  309: 
  310: %% handle_request/3
  311: 
  312: handle_request(#diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}},
  313:                OH,
  314:                {_Ref, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,_},
  315:                                      origin_realm = {OR, _}}})
  316:   when OH /= ?CLIENT ->
  317:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  318:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  319:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  320:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR}}.
  321: 
  322: %% ===========================================================================
  323: %% support functions
  324: 
  325: %% Send an STR intended for a specific server and expect success.
  326: call(Server) ->
  327:     ?TL("call -> entry with"
  328:         "~n   Server: ~p", [Server]),
  329:     Realm = realm(Server),
  330:     Req = ['STR', {'Destination-Realm', Realm},
  331:                   {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  332:                   {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}],
  333:     ?TL("call -> make (STR) call (with filter and realm) - expect STA"),
  334:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code'  = ?SUCCESS,
  335:                        'Origin-Host'  = Server,
  336:                        'Origin-Realm' = Realm}
  337:         = call(Req, [{filter, realm}]),
  338:     ?TL("call -> done"),
  339:     ok.
  340: 
  341: call(Req, Opts) ->
  342:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?APP_ALIAS, Req, Opts).
  343: 
  344: set([H|T], Vs) ->
  345:     [H | Vs ++ T].
  346: 
  347: realm(Host) ->
  348:     tl(lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C /= $. end, Host)).
  349: 
  350: inband_security(Ids) ->
  351:     [{'Inband-Security-Id', Ids}].
  352: 
  353: ssl_options(Dir, Base) ->
  354:     Root = filename:join([Dir, Base]),
  355:     [{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_none},{certfile, Root ++ "_ca.pem"},
  356:                     {keyfile,  Root ++ "_key.pem"}]}].
  357: 
  358: make_cert(Dir, Base) ->
  359:     make_cert(Dir, Base ++ "_key.pem", Base ++ "_ca.pem").
  360: 
  361: make_cert(Dir, Keyfile, Certfile) ->
  362:     [KP,CP] = [filename:join([Dir, F]) || F <- [Keyfile, Certfile]],
  363: 
  364:     KC = join(["openssl genrsa -out", KP, "2048"]),
  365:     CC = join(["openssl req -new -sha256 -x509 -key", KP, "-out", CP, "-days 7",
  366:                "-subj /C=SE/ST=./L=Stockholm/CN=www.erlang.org"]),
  367: 
  368:     %% Hope for the best and only check that files are written.
  369:     KR = os:cmd(KC),
  370:     {_, {ok, _}} = {KR, file:read_file_info(KP)},
  371:     CR = os:cmd(CC),
  372:     {_, {ok, _}} = {CR, file:read_file_info(CP)},
  373: 
  374:     {KP,CP}.
  375: 
  376: join(Strs) ->
  377:     string:join(Strs, " ").
  378: 
  379: %% server/2
  380: 
  381: server(Host, {Caps, Opts}) ->
  382:     ok = diameter:start_service(Host, ?SERVICE(Host, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  383:     {ok, LRef} = diameter:add_transport(Host, ?TLISTEN(Caps, Opts)),
  384:     {LRef, hd([_] = ?LPORT(tcp, LRef))}.
  385: 
  386: sopts(?SERVER1, Dir) ->
  387:     {inband_security([?TLS]),
  388:      ssl_options(Dir, "server1")};
  389: sopts(?SERVER2, Dir) ->
  390:     {inband_security([?NO_INBAND_SECURITY, ?TLS]),
  391:      ssl_options(Dir, "server2")};
  392: sopts(?SERVER3, _) ->
  393:     {[], []};
  394: sopts(?SERVER4, Dir) ->
  395:     {[], ssl(ssl_options(Dir, "server4"))};
  396: sopts(?SERVER5, Dir) ->
  397:     {[], ssl(ssl_options(Dir, "server5"))}.
  398: 
  399: ssl([{ssl_options = T, Opts}]) ->
  400:     [{T, true} | Opts].
  401: 
  402: %% connect/3
  403: 
  404: connect(Host, {_LRef, PortNr}, {Caps, Opts}) ->
  405:     {ok, Ref} = diameter:add_transport(Host, ?TCONNECT(PortNr, Caps, Opts)),
  406:     {up, Ref, _, _, #diameter_packet{}}
  407:          = receive
  408:                #diameter_event{service = Host, info = Info}
  409:                  when element(2, Info) == Ref ->
  410:                    Info
  411:            end,
  412:     Ref.
  413: 
  414: copts(S, Opts)
  415:   when S == ?SERVER1;
  416:        S == ?SERVER2;
  417:        S == ?SERVER3 ->
  418:     {inband_security([?NO_INBAND_SECURITY, ?TLS]), Opts};
  419: copts(S, Opts)
  420:   when S == ?SERVER4;
  421:        S == ?SERVER5 ->
  422:     {[], ssl(Opts)}.
